titles.en: The Book of Outfits and the Beautification and the Magnanimity
Chapter 31 – The black (dye) and the woad (a dyeing plant)
Chapter 32 – The dyeing with the henna

titles.ar: كتاب الزِّيِّ وَ التَّجَمُّلِ وَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
titles.en: The Book of Outfits and the Beautification and the Magnanimity
Chapter 31 – The black (dye) and the woad (a dyeing plant)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/376)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ سَيْفِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَكْرٍ الْحَضْرَمِيِّ قَالَ

text: كُنْتُ مَعَ أَبِي عَلْقَمَةَ وَ الْحَارِثِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ وَ أَبِي حَسَّانَ عِنْدَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ عَلْقَمَةُ مُخْتَضِبٌ بِالْحِنَّاءِ وَ الْحَارِثُ مُخْتَضِبٌ بِالْوَسِمَةِ وَ أَبُو حَسَّانَ لَا يَخْتَضِبُ فَقَالَ كُلُّ رَجُلٍ مِنْهُمْ مَا تَرَى فِي هَذَا رَحِمَكَ اللَّهُ وَ أَشَارَ إِلَى لِحْيَتِهِ فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مَا أَحْسَنَهُ قَالُوا كَانَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) مُخْتَضِباً بِالْوَسْمَةِ قَالَ نَعَمْ ذَلِكَ حِينَ تَزَوَّجَ الثَّقَفِيَّةَ أَخَذَتْهُ جَوَارِيهَا فَخَضَبْنَهُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Sayf Bin Ameyra, from Abu Bakr Al Hazramy who said,

‘I was with Abu Alqama and Al-Haris Bin Al-Mugheira, and Abu Hassan in the presence of Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, and Alqama had dyed with the henna, and Al-Haris had dyed with the black (dye), and Abu Hassan had not dyed. So each man from them said, ‘What is your<sup>asws</sup> view with regards to this, may Allah<sup>azwj</sup> have Mercy on you<sup>asws</sup>’, and gestured towards his own beard. So Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘How wonderful’. They said, ‘Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> used to dye with the woad (a dye plant)?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When he<sup>asws</sup> married the Saqafiyya, her slave girl took it, so she dye it upon him<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Sayf ibn ‘Amirah from abu Bakr al- Hadramiy who has said the following: “Once abu ‘Alqamah, al-Harith ibn al-Mughirah, abu Hassan and I were with abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, and ‘Alqamah had applied hair dye with henna, al-Harith had applied hair dye with woad and abu Hassan would not apply hair dye. Every man pointing to his beard asked him (the Imam), ‘What do you say about it (hair dye), may Allah grant you kindness ? 5 Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al- Salam, said, ‘It is very good . 5 They asked, ‘Did abu Ja’far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, apply hair dye ? 5 He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, when he married al-Thaqafiyah, her slave-girls applied hair dye to his hairs. 5 ”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/376)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الْوَسِمَةِ فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِهَا لِلشَّيْخِ الْكَبِيرِ.

en.hubeali: From him, from Ibn Mahboub, from Abdullah Bin Sinan who said,
‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about the woad (a dyeing plant), so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem with it for the old man, the aged’.
en.sarwar: 2. It is narrated from the narrator of the previous Hadith from ibn Mahbub from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about applying Woad. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful to an old man ."

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/376)

narrator_chain.text: ابْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ الْعَلَاءِ بْنِ رَزِينٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ

text: رَأَيْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَمْضَغُ عِلْكاً فَقَالَ يَا مُحَمَّدُ نَقَضَتِ الْوَسِمَةُ أَضْرَاسِي فَمَضَغْتُ هَذَا الْعِلْكَ لِأَشُدَّهَا قَالَ وَ كَانَتِ اسْتَرْخَتْ فَشَدَّهَا بِالذَّهَبِ .

en.hubeali: Ibn Mahboub, from Al A’ala Bin Razeyn, form Muhammad Bin Muslim who said,

‘I saw Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> chewing gum, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘O Muhammad! I<sup>asws</sup>, the woad (a dye plant) twisted my<sup>asws</sup> molar, so I am chewing this gum in order to strengthen it’. He (the narrator) said, ‘And they had loosened, so he<sup>asws</sup> tightened them with the gold’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ibn Mahbub has narrated from al-‘Ala’ ibn Razin from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once saw abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, chewing gums and he (the Imam) said, ‘O Muhammad, woad has loosened my molar teeth so I chew gums to strengthen them . 5 His teeth had become loose so he tied them with gold.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/377)

narrator_chain.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ ثَعْلَبَةَ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) نَقَضَتْ أَضْرَاسِيَ الْوَسِمَةُ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Ibn Fazzal Bin Maymoun, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said,
‘Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘My<sup>asws</sup> molar was loosened by the woad (a dyeing plant)’.
en.sarwar: 4. Abu Ali al-Ash‘ariy has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from ibn Faddal from Tha’labah ibn Maymun from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “Abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, said, ‘Woad has affected my molar teeth. 5 ”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/377)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ عِدَّةٍ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ عَنْ عَمِّهِ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ سَالِمٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قُتِلَ الْحُسَيْنُ ( صلوات الله عليه ) وَ هُوَ مُخْتَضِبٌ بِالْوَسْمَةِ .

en.hubeali: A number or our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from a number of our companions, from Ali Bin Asbaat, from his uncle Yaqoub Bin Salim who said,
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup> was killed and he<sup>asws</sup> had dyed with the woad (a dyeing plant)’.
en.sarwar: 5. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn abu ‘Abd Allah from a number of his people from Ali ibn Asbat from his uncle Ya‘qub ibn Salim who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘At the time al-Husayn, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, was murdered he had applied hair dye with woad. 5 ”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/377)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ أَبِي بَكْرٍ الْحَضْرَمِيِّ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الْخِضَابِ بِالْوَسْمَةِ فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ قَدْ قُتِلَ الْحُسَيْنُ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ مُخْتَضِبٌ بِالْوَسْمَةِ .

en.hubeali: From him, from his father, from Yunus, from Abu Bakr Al Hazramy who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about the dyeing with the woad (a dyeing plant), so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem. Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup> was killed and he<sup>asws</sup> dyed with the woad (a dyeing plant)’.
en.sarwar: 6. It is narrated from the narrator of the previous Hadith from his father from Yunus from abu Bakr al-Hadramiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about applying hair dye with woad. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful. At the time al-Husayn, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, was murdered he had applied hair dye with woad. 5 ”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/377)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْجَوْهَرِيِّ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ عُمَرَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ الْخِضَابُ بِالسَّوَادِ أُنْسٌ لِلنِّسَاءِ وَ مَهَابَةٌ لِلْعَدُوِّ .

en.hubeali: From him, from his father, from Al Qasim Bin Muhammad Al Jowhary, from Al Husayn Bin Umar Bin Yazeed, from his father who said,
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘The dyeing with the black (dye) is amusing for the women, and an awe to the enemy’.
en.sarwar: 7. It is narrated from the narrator of the previous Hadith from his father from al-Qasim ibn Muhammad al-Jawhariy from al-Husayn ibn ‘Umar ibn Yazid from his father who has said the following: “I once heard abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, saying, ‘Applying black hair dye is entertaining for women and show one’s firmness to the enemy. 5 ”
